intro: Horkelia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. Horkelia mutabilis is often found in regions with mild, moist climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments.
